reviews.review_msg: 1) soc & poli philosophy 2) 421ST-Metaethics: papers asked us 2advance our positions on the course themes referrng 2 maj issus andor readngs fr class.made arg mostly fr continental/poststruct phenomenolgcl & german idealst vein. he dogmtcly rjctdt whle movments. comnts raisd objctns alrdy answrd. smug jerk if ur position is against his academc bias

Dr. Warriner is a professional, competent teacher. I felt that the course material she put together was interesting and fit for the course level. She was patient with questions and handled them well. This course may not be for those not particularly interested in philosophy. Overall I thought her a fair marker and clear lecturer.

Be prepared to waste valuable time and money. If this is a required course for you -- be forewarned and take it with someone (anyone) else. She's a complicated one.  Unless you have the time and effort to distract yourself from your studies, run for the hills. But, if you happen to get trapped in her class, lay low and you should get by unscathed.

An angel of a professor. We had a very annoying student in our course who would literally look up arguments against the papers she assigned and read them off his computer in class. She never once lost her temper and treated everyone always professionally and fairly. She is very dedicated, always ready to help out a student.

Bruno is a good professor. He's knowledgeable and explains concepts well. However, it seemed his personal writing style would get in the way of being objective when grading student's papers. If it isn't the way he thinks a paper should be structured, he's rather inflexible. This is unlike other Philosophy profs. Wouldn't take again for this reason.

Professor Guindon is very knowledgeable. This course was definitely tougher than other 200 level phil classes. There were weekly in-class group questions that had to be done within the hour, so that was pretty intense. Outside of that though, the papers are generally alright, and there are many paper topics provided.

Dr guidon is a really really great professor. He's very understanding and explains concepts really clearly. His lectures are very engaging. He has high standards for your work but as long as you put some effort in it's definitely very possible to do well. He's really helpful in office hours, so definitely recommend discussing assignments with him

Im not a phil major so I went into this class not knowing as much as everyone else but I still found myself understanding the material well. Read the textbook!! Its actually an enjoyable read imo. Bruno can be kind of wordy in lecture, so the textbook clears things up. Papers were short with many topic choices.

I would say Evan is a good prof, he really digs into the readings and tries to explain every single detail for you. But this makes the lecture become a bit heavy for a 3-credit 200-lv course. He also grades a bit tough because he really wants students to success in the future. Overall, you should take his course to learn more.

Took this a couple sems ago. But she is awesome! Very knowledgable and actually wants her students to understand material. She MAKES SURE yall understand. I love it. Tests were reasonable and lectures feel like you're having an insightful conversation. No laptops allowed, only paper. Improved my memory retention by a MILE.
